image_worker.augment¶

Submodules¶

image_worker.augment.augmenter module¶

This module is used to augment images.

class image_worker.augment.augmenter.Augmenter¶

A class used to augment images. When creating an instance of this class, you can specify the path to your data. Then you can specify the augmenting types. These will be set to a todolist. So when finally you choose to either view a few augmented images or augment all images and save them to a new directory the todolist will be executed.

do_gaussianBlur(intensity_from=0.5, intensity_to=3.0)¶

Blur the image with a gaussian blur. It augments with a random intensity between the specified parameters.

intensity_fromfloat

The lowest intensity of the gaussian blur. Ranging from 0 to unlimited. Intensity 0 is no blur. Intensity 3.0 is much blur.

intensity_tofloat

The highest intensity of the gaussian blur. Ranging from 0 to unlimited. Intensity 0 is no blur. Intensity 3.0 is much blur.

ValueError

If the intensity_from or intensity_to is not a float or int. If the intensity_from is greater than the intensity_to. If the intensity_from or intensity_to is less than 0.0.

>>> from image_worker.augment import Augmenter
>>> augmenter = Augmenter()
>>> augmenter.do_gaussianBlur(0.5, 3.0)
Added gaussian blur to the augmenting todo list.
do_sharpen(intensity_from=0.1, intensity_to=0.5)¶

Sharpen the image with a sharpen. It augments with a random intensity between the specified parameters.

intensity_fromfloat

The lowest percent intensity of the sharpen. Ranging from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%). Intensity 0 is no sharpen. Intensity 0.7 is much sharpen.

intensity_tofloat

The highest percent intensity of the sharpen. Ranging from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%). Intensity 0 is no sharpen. Intensity 0.7 is much sharpen.

ValueError

If the intensity_from or intensity_to is not a float or int. If the intensity_from is greater than the intensity_to. If the intensity_from or intensity_to less than 0.0. If the intensity_from or intensity_to is greater than 1.0.

>>> from image_worker.augment import Augmenter
>>> augmenter = Augmenter()
>>> augmenter.do_sharpen(0.1, 0.5)
Added sharpen to the augmenting todo list.
specify_path(path, type_of_image=None)¶

Specify the path to the data.

pathstr

The path to the data.

type_of_imagestr

The type of the image.

ValueError

If the path is not a string. If type_of_image is not None, “jpg” og “png”.

>>> augmenter.specify_path("/home/user/data/", "jpg")
Specified path to data: /home/user/data/ and type of image: jpg
